answers.answer: This is known as 'Traumatic Onycholysis'.This is sometimes complicated by bacterial infection.Best to get a culture test and antibiotics, especially if it is psedomonas (Green colour nail). Being a diabetic you should take care of your feet.You may just need external medication.Do consult your doc.Best wishes.
Went to the doctor and she said that it is a fungal infection.  She prescribed an anti-fungal nail polish. It will take 90 days to heal.thanks everyoneAngela

question: I am a 50 y/o woman who was diagnosed with diabetes mellitus last year.  My dog bit my thumbnail, his teeth went down directly into the lunula part of the nail That area has swollen to 2 to 3 times its size, the rest of the nail won't grow and there is a big black color that starts at the lunula to the tip of the nail. The original nail has since come off bit by bit.  This happened last November.  What should I do?  Angela
title: Dog bit my nail.
